name: wikipedia_random_article
description: Navigate to a random Wikipedia article and scrape its content. Returns a random article title, summary, categories, and key information.

steps.code: const titleEl = document.querySelector('#firstHeading, h1'); const content = document.querySelector('#mw-content-text .mw-parser-output'); const paragraphs = content ? content.querySelectorAll(':scope > p') : []; let summary = ''; for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(paragraphs.length, 3); i++) { const text = paragraphs[i].textContent.trim(); if (text.length > 50) { summary += text + ' '; } } const infobox = {}; const infoboxEl = document.querySelector('.infobox, .vcard'); if (infoboxEl) { const rows = infoboxEl.querySelectorAll('tr'); rows.forEach(function(row) { const th = row.querySelector('th'); const td = row.querySelector('td'); if (th && td) { infobox[th.textContent.trim()] = td.textContent.trim().substring(0, 200); } }); } const categories = []; const catLinks = document.querySelectorAll('#catlinks li a, #mw-normal-catlinks li a'); catLinks.forEach(function(a) { categories.push(a.textContent.trim()); }); const images = []; const imgEls = content ? content.querySelectorAll('img[src*="upload.wikimedia"]') : []; imgEls.forEach(function(img) { const src = img.getAttribute('src'); if (src && src.includes('upload.wikimedia') && !images.includes(src)) images.push(src.startsWith('//') ? 'https:' + src : src); }); return { title: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : '', summary: summary.trim().substring(0, 2000), infobox: infobox, categories: categories.slice(0, 10), images: images.slice(0, 3), url: window.location.href }
steps.name: article_data
steps.label: Extract random article
